revised_title: Inquiry into the Formation of Alkaline and Earthy Bodies in Plants and the Influence of Carbonic Acid
tldr: The author investigates the formation of alkaline and earthy bodies in plants and their relationship with carbonic acid. He finds that these bodies are formed during fermentation and that the absorption of carbonic acid precedes their formation. The absorption of carbonic acid by the soil is greatest during the night and is regulated by a compensating provision in nature, maintaining a constant proportion of carbonic acid in the atmosphere.
